metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14305 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: An out-of-bounds memory write flaw was found in how the Linux kernelâ€™s Voice Over IP H.323 connection tracking functionality handled connections on ipv6 port 1720. This flaw allows an unauthenticated remote user to crash the system, causing a denial of service. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.

notes.Note: sbeattie> fixed in 4.11 and newer with 9f0f3ebeda47a5518817f33c40f6d3ea9c0275b8

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
